subject: Re: [junit] failing to generate error on NullPointerException
msgSnippet: The phrase that caught my eye, and should be elaborated on is The unit test is catching Exception .  If it s catching it, how do you expect the framework to
messageBody:
The phrase that caught my eye, and should be elaborated on is "The unit
test is catching Exception". If it's catching it, how do you expect the
framework to know about it? Can you provide an example of your UT?

Jesse McConnell wrote:

>I am getting a very strange result from juint.
>
>The following is the results of a unit test, but as you can see, it is
>not being caught as a failure or error. The unit test is catching
>Exception, but this is the result.
>
>We have our unit tests implemented as inner classes, could that make a
>difference with this? I am very confused by this. Using the junit
>target in Ant to produce these results.
>
>Thoughts?
>
>Jesse
>
>--
>
>Running com.gallup.g.LanguageHandler$TEST
>Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 0.012 sec
>Output:
>setDocumentLocator()
>startDocument()
>
>Error:
>java.lang.NullPointerException
